column4: Can I get to a 'true' command prompt outside of Gnome somehow?
(and lol, that's for posting how to get back before I went and got myself locked out)
I want to setup my computer before I go to bed so I can play with Linux remotely when I'm supposed to be doing work :P
Will I be able to telnet into my computer by default, or do I need to turn on?
Is that in the inetd file I hear so much about?
Ahh, ty, ty - good point.  Even on windows I had an ssh client
I never reinstalled Ubuntu (using it since sept. 04) except for one time when I broke it vigorously by removing a shitload of essential files
even linux isn't foolproof (fools are always more stupid than you think)
food questions in the offtopic channel please...
on breezy: no, it would break far too much
Break?  er, how do you mean?
